Cheapbabi drawers for shape plots

Useful drawers for building custom shape plots using the cheapbabi approach. See examples and vignettes.

draw_polygon(coo, f, border = par("fg"), col = NA, lwd = 1, lty = 1,
  ...)

draw_outline(coo, f, border = par("fg"), col = NA, lwd = 1, lty = 1,
  ...)

draw_outlines(coo, f, border = par("fg"), col = NA, lwd = 1, lty = 1,
  ...)

draw_points(coo, f, col = par("fg"), cex = 1, pch = 20, ...)

draw_landmarks(coo, f, col = par("fg"), cex = 1, pch = 20, ...)

draw_lines(coo, f, col = par("fg"), lwd = 1, lty = 1, ...)

draw_centroid(coo, f, col = par("fg"), pch = 3, cex = 0.5, ...)

draw_curve(coo, f, col = par("fg"), lwd = 1, lty = 1, ...)

draw_curves(coo, f, col = par("fg"), lwd = 1, lty = 1, ...)

draw_firstpoint(coo, f, label = "^", col = par("fg"), cex = 1, ...)

draw_axes(coo, col = "#333333", cex = 3/4, lwd = 3/4, ...)

draw_labels(coo, labels = 1:nrow(coo), cex = 1/2, d = 1/20, ...)

draw_links(coo, f, links, col = "#99999955", lwd = 1/2, lty = 1, ...)

Arguments

coo

matrix of 2 columns for (x, y) coordinates
f

an optionnal factor specification to feed. See examples and vignettes.
border

color (hexadecimal) to draw components
col

color (hexadecimal) to draw components
lwd

to draw components
lty

to draw components
...

additional options to feed core functions for each drawer
cex

to draw components
pch

to draw components
label

to indicate first point
labels

character name of labels to draw (defaut to 1:nrow(coo))
d

numeric proportion of d(centroid-each_point) to add when centrifugating landmarks
links

matrix of links to use to draw segments between landmarks. See wings$ldk for an example

Note

This approach will (soon) replace coo_plot and friends in further versions. All comments are welcome.

See also

cheapbabi_layers

Other cheapbabi: layers, papers, plot_PCA

Examples

bot[1] %>% paper_grid() %>% draw_polygon()
olea %>% paper_chess %>% draw_lines(~var)

hearts[240] %>% paper_white() %>% draw_outline() %>%
  coo_sample(24) %>% draw_landmarks %>% draw_labels() %>%
  draw_links(links=replicate(2, sample(1:24, 8)))
